001package imagingbook.calibration.zhang;
002
003import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
004import java.util.ArrayList;
005import java.util.List;
006
007import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
008
009import imagingbook.calibration.zhang.util.MathUtil;
010import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
011import imagingbook.lib.util.ParameterBundle;
012
013
014/**
015 * This is an implementation of the camera calibration method 
016 * described in
017 *   Z. Zhang, "A flexible new technique for camera calibration",
018 *   IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 
019 *   22(11), pp. 1330-1334, 2000.
020 * See also 
021 * <a href="http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/zhang/Calib/">
022 * http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/zhang/Calib/</a>
023 * and
024 * <a href="http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/zhang/Papers/TR98-71.pdf">
025 * http://research.microsoft.com/en-us/um/people/zhang/Papers/TR98-71.pdf</a>
026 * 
027 * @author W. Burger
028 * @version 2018/12/29
029 */
030public class Calibrator {
031        
032        /**
033         * Inner class representing a set of parameters for instantiating
034         * new objects of type of {@link Calibrator}. 
035         * Parameters can be specified by setting the associated public fields.
036         */
037        public static class Parameters implements ParameterBundle {
038                /** Normalize point coordinates for numerical stability in {@link HomographyEstimator}. */
039                public boolean normalizePointCoordinates = true;
040                /** Assume that the camera has no skew (currently not used). */
041                public boolean assumeZeroSkew = false;
042                /** Use numeric (instead of analytic) calculation of the Jacobian in {@link NonlinearOptimizer}. */
043                public boolean useNumericJacobian = false;
044                /** Number of lens distortion coefficients (2 = simple polynomial model). */
045                public int lensDistortionKoeffients = 2;
046                /** Turn on debugging output. */
047                public boolean debug = false;                                   
048        }
049        
050        private int M;                                                          // the number of camera views
051        private final Point2D[] modelPts;                       // the sequence of 2D points in the planar model
052        private final List<Point2D[]> imgPntSet;        // list of vectors containing observed 2D image points for each view
053        
054        private Point2D[][] obsPts = null;
055        private final Parameters params;
056        private Camera initCam, finalCam;
057        private ViewTransform[] initViews, finalViews;
058        
059        // ------- constructors ------------------------------
060        
061        /**
062         * The only constructor. 
063         * @param params a parameter object (default parameters are used if {@code null} is passed)
064         * @param model a sequence of 2D points specifying the x/y coordinates of 
065         *                      the planar calibration pattern (assuming zero z-coordinates)
066         */
067        public Calibrator(Parameters params, Point2D[] model) {
068                this.params = (params != null) ? params : new Parameters();
069                this.modelPts = model;
070                this.imgPntSet = new ArrayList<Point2D[]>();
071        }
072        
073        /**
074         * Adds a new observation (a sequence of 2D image points) of the planar calibration pattern.
075         * @param pts a sequence of 2D image points
076         */
077        public void addView(Point2D[] pts) {
078                imgPntSet.add(pts);
079        }
080        
081        /**
082         * Performs the actual camera calibration based on the provided sequence of views.
083         * @return the estimated camera intrinsics as a {@link Camera} object
084         */
085        public Camera calibrate() {
086                M = imgPntSet.size();   // number of views to process
087                if (M < 2) {
088                        throw new IllegalStateException("Calibration: at least two views needed");
089                }
090                
091                obsPts = imgPntSet.toArray(new Point2D[0][]);
092                
093                // Step 1: Calculate the homographies for each of the given N views:
094                HomographyEstimator hest = new HomographyEstimator(params.normalizePointCoordinates, true);
095                RealMatrix[] H_init = hest.estimateHomographies(modelPts, obsPts);
096                
097                // Step 2: Estimate the intrinsic parameters by linear optimization:
098                CameraIntrinsicsEstimator cis = new CameraIntrinsicsEstimator();
099                
100                RealMatrix A_init = cis.getCameraIntrinsics(H_init);
101                initCam = new Camera(A_init, new double[params.lensDistortionKoeffients]);
102                
103                // Step 3: calculate the extrinsic view parameters:
104                ExtrinsicViewEstimator eve = new ExtrinsicViewEstimator(A_init);
105                initViews = eve.getExtrinsics(H_init);
106                
107                // Step 4: Determine the lens distortion from initial estimates:
108                RadialDistortionEstimator rde = new RadialDistortionEstimator();
109                double[] distParams = rde.estimateLensDistortion(initCam, initViews, modelPts, obsPts);
110                Camera improvedCam = new Camera(A_init, distParams);
111                
112                // Step 5: Refine all parameters by non-linear optimization
113                NonlinearOptimizer optimizer = (params.useNumericJacobian) ?
114                                new NonlinearOptimizerNumeric(modelPts, obsPts) :
115                                new NonlinearOptimizerAnalytic(modelPts, obsPts);
116                optimizer.optimize(improvedCam, initViews);
117                finalCam = optimizer.getFinalCamera();
118                finalViews = optimizer.getFinalViews();
119
120                return finalCam;
121        }
122        
123        
124        //---------------------------------------------------------------------------
125        
126        @SuppressWarnings("unused")
127        private void printHomographies(RealMatrix[] homographies) {
128                int i = 0;
129                for (RealMatrix H : homographies) {
130                        i++;
131                        System.out.println("Homography " + i + ":");
132                        System.out.println(Matrix.toString(H.getData()));
133                }
134        }
135        
136        /**
137         * Calculates the squared projection error for a single view, associated
138         * with a set of observed image points.
139         * @param cam a camera model (camera intrinsics)
140         * @param view a view transformation (camera extrinsics)
141         * @param observed a set of observed image points
142         * @return the squared projection error (measured in pixel units)
143         */
144    public double getProjectionError(Camera cam, ViewTransform view, Point2D[] observed) {
145        double sqError = 0;
146                for (int j = 0; j < modelPts.length; j++) {
147                        double[] uv = cam.project(view, modelPts[j]);
148                        double[] UV = MathUtil.toArray(observed[j]);
149                        double du = uv[0] - UV[0];
150                        double dv = uv[1] - UV[1];
151                        sqError = sqError + du * du + dv * dv;
152                }
153        return sqError;
154    }
155    
156        /**
157         * Calculates the squared projection error for a sequence of views, associated
158         * with a sequence of observed image point sets.
159         * @param cam a camera model (camera intrinsics)
160         * @param views a sequence of view transformations (camera extrinsics)
161         * @param observed a sequence of sets of observed image points
162         * @return the squared projection error (measured in pixel units)
163         */
164    public double getProjectionError(Camera cam, ViewTransform[] views, Point2D[][] observed) {
165        double totalError = 0;
166        for (int i = 0; i < views.length; i++) {
167                totalError = totalError + getProjectionError(cam, views[i], observed[i]);
168        }
169        return totalError;
170    }
171    
172    // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
173    
174    /**
175     * Returns the initial camera model (no lens distortion).
176     * @return the initial camera model
177     */
178    public Camera getInitialCamera() {
179        return initCam;
180    }
181    
182    /**
183     * Returns the final camera model (including lens distortion).
184     * @return the final camera model
185     */
186    public Camera getFinalCamera() {
187        return finalCam;
188    }
189    
190    /**
191     * Returns the sequence of initial camera views (extrinsics, no 
192     * lens distortion).
193     * @return the sequence of initial camera views
194     */
195    public ViewTransform[] getInitialViews() {
196        return initViews;
197    }
198    
199    /**
200     * Returns the sequence of final camera views (extrinsics, including 
201     * lens distortion).
202     * @return the sequence of final camera views
203     */
204    public ViewTransform[] getFinalViews() {
205        return finalViews;
206    }
207    
208}
